did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Anna Elsbree papers, 1788-1953.
did.physdesc: Correspondence, an autograph album, an account book, a recipe book, a photograph album, photographs, broadsides, pamphlets, and other materials.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes genealogical correspondence, 1922-53; mimeographed Elsbree family letters and other papers; letters and other papers of Jabez and Lewis Beers relating to the New Jerusalem Church of Danby, 1815-74, and to the Ithaca and Owego Turnpike Company, 1810-20; attendance records and other papers of the Tornado Hook and Ladder Company, No. 3, Ithaca, 1843-1928; notes and clippings on history of Ithaca and Tompkins County; commencement ball in New Haven; invitations; cemetery records from Tompkins County; autograph album, account and recipe book, and photograph album of Llewellyn Elsbree; many family and other photographs; broadsides and pamphlets; and much miscellaneous material on local history and genealogy.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes genealogical correspondence, 1922-53; mimeographed Elsbree family letters and other papers; letters and other papers of Jabez and Lewis Beers relating to the New Jerusalem Church of Danby, 1815-74, and to the Ithaca and Owego Turnpike Company, 1810-20; attendance records and other papers of the Tornado Hook and Ladder Company, No. 3, Ithaca, 1843-1928; notes and clippings on history of Ithaca and Tompkins County; commencement ball in New Haven; invitations; cemetery records from Tompkins County; autograph album, account and recipe book, and photograph album of Llewellyn Elsbree; many family and other photographs; broadsides and pamphlets; and much miscellaneous material on local history and genealogy.

Jabez and Lewis Beers: New Jerusalem Society of the County of Tioga Church, Danby (Tioga County) papers; Ithaca & Owego Turnpike items

scopecontent.p: 1788-1874, n.d.: bills, receipts and IOU's etc.; 1769-1849: Lewis Beers, president of Ithaca & Owego Turnpike Co.; physician and preacher, 1810-1820; 1788: Jabez Beers certified by Dr. Joseph Poor as unfit for military duty; 1815: May 30, announcement of election of trustees (recorded May 31); 1817, March 16, agreement "to associate in Church Order" signed by Lewis and Jabez Beers, Moses Tyler and others at Danby; 1817, March 23, adoption of 2 articles as "sole bonds of Church Association;" 1819, May 29, baptismal certificate

did.unittitle: Jabez and Lewis Beers: New Jerusalem Church papers; Ithaca & Owego Turnpike item

scopecontent.p: 1824, Dec. 20, New Jerusalem Society - announcement of annual meeting, signed by Elbert Curtis, Sec'y; 1822, April 21, Danby - copy of letter "Dear Sister" on religion and work of the society, unsigned (Jabez Beers?); 1822, May 21, Danby, copy of letter sent to Annual Convention, Philadelphia regarding "present unhappy division of sentiments which prevail respecting the pastoral relation of the Minister to his Society;" 1824, Jan. 10, record of resolution to build church and to start a subscription; 1825, Jan. 19, list of subscribers to building fund; 1831, July 25, copy of agreement signed by members to subscribe specified sums of money for erecting a public library "to consist of book in which the Doctrines of the New Jerusalem Church are contained and taught, and also books in which those doctrines are questioned or disputed;" 1843, Oct. 10, deed, Lewis Beers to the First New Jerusalem Church of the County of Tioga (now Tompkins) land on which church was erected; undated, list of subscribers to purchase organ

Tornado Hook & Ladder Co. #3 papers (probably originally collected by Dr. Coville)

scopecontent.p: Lists of members and attendance records, menus, announcements of meetings, a few letters of resignation, etc., record of men in Service, June 1, 1918, annual report for 1928, broadside (in broadside collection); 1843,Feb. 21, lady's ticket - First Annual Ball - Fire Co. #3; booklets: Articles of Incorporation, By-Laws, Rules of Order and Membership, Ithaca, 1887; photograph of painting of bucket brigade fighting blaze; copies of photographs of old fire engines

did.unittitle: Tornado Hook and Ladder Company papers
Elsbree Family papers

scopecontent.p: Mimeographed family letters (1941-1951); typescript copy of statement of Nov. 15, 1933 regarding Ithaca Trust Co. as Trustee v. Ernest Blaker and Cascadilla School Association, and resultant payment of $8.04 to Estate of Phebe C. Elsbree, as bondholder; children's letters: Nathan Elsbree to Mother, July 4, 1887, one signed "Thomas," n.d. and another Llewelyn, both to their grandmother, n.d.; 2 postcards and letter to Anna E. from John? (cousin) (1942); typescript copy of will of Ephraim Elsbree, Jan. 3, 1761; 1872-1927 invitations

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Papers

scopecontent.p: Letter to Miss Curtis, June 7, 1926, from Adelaide Curtis Gunther; 2 undated and unsigned poems written longhand on fashions; Oct. 18, 1897, card to Prof. E. Hitchcock, Jr.; letter (March 2, 1932) and 4 postcards (1941) to a Mrs. Harry G. Morgan, Ithaca, from her daughter; typescript copy of letter of Oct. 1828 from Betsy Curtis to her aunt (?) describing ball at the (Yale?) commencement exercises, and commenting on family matters
